author: Special Correspondent
text:
The South India Film Artistes Association launched the work of registering the details of the drama artistes of the western districts of Salem, Krishnagiri and Dharmapuri here on Saturday.

The Association has introduced the scheme of ‘Gurudhakshanai’ to identify its members who were suffering from financial constraints; and render help to them.

Under this programme, the association has taken steps for registering the details of the drama artistes of the three districts. A five member team from the Association, led by actor Kovai Sarala arrived here on Saturday and registered the details of more than 140 drama artistes of these districts.

The details were also video graphed.

Kovai Sarala told presspersons that the details of the talented drama artistes will also be provided to the film producers and directors with a request to consider them for acting in their films.
title: South India Film Artistes Association introduces ‘Gurudhakshanai’ scheme
